result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy L Childs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
Bail Forfeiture
10/31/2016 Court orders signature bond reinstated. Vacate prior judgment.

supervisions.notes:
Fine and costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 1/1/17 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentence credit of 10 days was granted.  TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: Return of Order Vacating Bail Forfeiture to defendant.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/2/16 at 9:00 a.m.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on:10/26/16
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Timothy L Childs in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 10:19 for plea and sentencing.  Victim rights notification has been complied with.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statements by  the Defendant.

  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  10 days,  (Credit -10 days). Court deems time served.

COURT COSTS: $253.00 (pay $25.00/month commencing 1/1/17 or serve 9 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid at $25.00/month consecutive to payment of fine or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of surcharge.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Timothy L Childs did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Attorney Schleis believes his client was unaware of the change of date for this hearing.  The original hearing date is still set on the calendar for 11/14/16.  Court orders capias STAYED until that date.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Court orders signature bond reinstated. Vacate prior judgment.
Hearing on November 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
vacating bail forfeiture of the $750.00 signature bond and $50.00 costs is dated 1/18/16 is hereby vacated in its entirely and reinstated.
Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save or any witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Bond to be co-signed by the Defendant's daughter.

Defendant Timothy L Childs in court, in custody.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Cameron Weitzner appears as a friend of the Court.   The Defendant advises the Court he was hospitalized and that is the reason for his missed court appearance.  The Defendant is to reapply at the public defenders office.  The State does not object to the Court reinstating the previously forfeited signature bond.    The Court reinstates the previously forfeited $750.00 signature bond and sets another surety bond to be co-signed by the daughter in the amount of $500.00.  The Defendant is allowed to make non-collect phone calls.  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Judgment of bail/bond forfeiture returned.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 12/9/15 at 9:30 a.m.
Bail Forfeiture
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
Branch 9 only.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Timothy L Childs did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Schleis advises the Court that the Defendant has not arrived for Court yet as he is on his way via the bus and requests the Court continue the stay of the warrant.     Defendant did not appear, case was set for 9:30, case was called at 12:00 p.m.  Based on defendant's non appearance, Court orders bail be revoked and forfieted.  Court issues capias.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-09-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Timothy L Childs not in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis advises the Court that the Defendant is hospitalized  and that is the reason for his non appearance today.  The Court issues but stays a capias until the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-23-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Timothy L Childs in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date in 45 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
